content: by the first green rw on the leg chart leg following the leg chart starting from the bottom knit the whole of the leg in stranded knitting us- ing the colours as indicated or substituting your own if you prefer the chart is for the whole leg so you will knit it just once both width wise and length wise but feel free to leave out or repeat individual borders if you prefer a shorter or longer leg heel put the 40 sts indicated on the leg chart onto a spare needle and work a short row heel as follows with the colour of your choice row1 sl1 k to last st wrap & turn row2 p to last st wrap & turn you should now have 2 row of your heel and the wrapped sts either side should be a different colour to the heel sts row3 k to st before the first wrapped st wrap & turn row4 p to st before the first wrapped st wrap & turn repeat these two row until you have wrapped 13 sts either side with 14 live sts in the middle ready to start the next knit row row 1 sl1 k to first wrapped st lift the wrap over the st and knit the stitch and its wrap together tbl turn row 2 sl1 p to first wrapped st lift the wrap over the st and purl the stitch and its wrap together turn hohoho page 3 repeat these two row until you have only one wrapped st left either side these are the two stitches from the very beginning that should be in a different colour row 1 sl1 k to the wrapped st lift the wrap over the st and knit the stitch and its wrap together tbl wrap the next st the first stitch on your other needle and turn row 2 sl1 p to the wrapped st lift the wrap over the st and purl the stitch and its wrap together wrap the next st the last stitch on your other needle and turn this concludes the heel foot count 20 sts into the heel to find the centre back this will be the new beginning of your round re- arrange your sts accordingly join the appropriate colour for the first row of the foot chart and knit the first round when you come to the wrapped sts either side of the heel lift the wrap over the st and knit the stitch and its wrap together as before this should neaten the join at this edge but you can always go back later and stitch it closed from the inside work the remaining rounds from the foot chart in stranded knitting as for the leg the last round in dark red is the first round for the toe toe appropriately for a christmas stocking this is a star toe but feel free to substitute the toe construc- tion of your choice using the toe colour
